channel.title: Comments on: Documentation
channel.description: Don't document the program; program the document.

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Hi Stephan, First of all I would like to thank you for your valueable comment. I do agree with your suggestion but at the time of writing of above code I was not aware about JSON objects.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Stephan,
First of all I would like to thank you for your valueable comment.
I do agree with your suggestion but at the time of writing of above code I was not aware about JSON objects.

item.title: By: Stephan H. Wissel
item.dc:creator: Stephan H. Wissel
item.description:
getType() would benefit from less elseIf :-) Why not use a JSON object to keep your classname/label relations, so you can extend it easily when adding new classes. Something like: knownControls = { "com.ibm.xsp.DataIterator" : "Repeat Control", "com.ibm.xsp.XPager" : "Pager", ... }
what also might make sense is to document parent (and eventually grandparent).
item.content:encoded:
getType() would benefit from less elseIf ðŸ™‚
Why not use a JSON object to keep your classname/label relations, so you can extend it easily when adding new classes. Something like:
knownControls = {
“com.ibm.xsp.DataIterator” : “Repeat Control”,
“com.ibm.xsp.XPager” : “Pager”,
…
}

what also might make sense is to document parent
(and eventually grandparent).
